profile.profileDescription: Profile for the INBO natural science collection

label.name_singular: No open publishing of sequence data
label.name_plural: No open publishing of sequence data

label.name: Types of relation that seeds in a seedlot can have.

label.name_singular: Multiple mother- and fatherplants from the same locality/place
label.name_plural: Multiple mother- and fatherplants from the same locality/place

label.name_singular: Multiple mother- and fatherplants from the different localities/places (but same taxon)
label.name_plural: Multiple mother- and fatherplants from the different localities/places (but same taxon)

label.name: Types of relation that seeds in a seedlot can have.

label.name_singular: no indication of being currently reproductive
label.name_plural: no indication of being currently reproductive

label.name_singular: no indication of being currently reproductive
label.name_plural: no indication of being currently reproductive

label.name_singular: no. of seeds germinated per gram
label.name_plural: no. of seeds germinated per gram

label.name_singular: restriction in reuse of generated objects
label.name_plural: restriction in reuse of generated objects

label.name_singular: the external specimen is the parent
label.name_plural: the external specimen is the parent

label.name_singular: The external specimen is a subsample
label.name_plural: The external specimen is a subsample

label.name_singular: The external specimen is a replicate specimen
label.name_plural: The external specimen is a replicate specimen

label.name_singular: Other type of relationship, see specification
label.name_plural: Other type of relationship, see specification

label.name_singular: do not publish the verbatim notes
label.name_plural: do not publish the verbatim notes

label.name_singular: other - please specify in the data export specification field
label.name_plural: other - please specify in the data export specification field

label.name: Description
label.description: A description, if non-original - with attribution to its source (url).

label.name: Description
label.description: dc:description

label.name: Source of description
label.description: Source of description. Preferable refer to a DOI.

label.name: File-URL
label.description: An URL that leads to a (multimedia) file or folder (containing multimedia such as photo, video, sound,...) that is saved in the INBO-CMS shared folder, the INBO tandemVault or any other published open web URL.

label.name: Multimedia description
label.description: Short description of the file and its relevance

label.name: Quality of the record
label.description: Flag and description indicating quality of the result. Indication of any quality issues with (-), or verification of (+), (parts of) the object record. After creation of the record, a user or data manager can flag the record to be followed up. For example: a mismatch in data (e.g. coordinates don't match locality description). For example: verified that the identification is correct by expert, from the photo evidence.

label.name: qualityType
label.description: Type of quality flag

label.name: Quality specification
label.description: Specification that explains the quality flag, explain in detail (e.g. mismatch -> between the coordinates and the locality description).

label.name: Reference
label.description: A (DOI of) a publication that refers to the sampling point, specimen or collection. This can be an internal INBO document on the Google drive, a published or unpublished dataset, a link to an INBO database (use the INBO datacatalogue),..

label.name: resourceURI
label.description: A preferably resolvable URI to uniquely identify a concept. For example a DOI-url.

label.name: Reference Details
label.description: Relevant information about the reference - why is it listed? - what does it say about the specimen/collection?

label.name: External record
label.description: An URL that can be used to uniquely identify the record, published on an external repository or website.

label.name: Dataset
label.description: A dataset

label.name: Verbatim Notes
label.description: Any unstructured information (e.g. notes, comments) literally transcribed from the original source.

label.name: Date (range) and time (range)
label.description: Represents an historic date range accepting date/time range expressions in the formats acceptedby the CA TimeExpressionParser module.

label.name: verbatimDate
label.description: The verbatim original representation of the date and time information for an Event.

label.name: Address
label.description: A physical postal address for an organisational unit or person.

label.name: Street name
label.description: The street address. For example, 1600 Amphitheatre Pkwy.

label.name: Post Office Box Number
label.description: The post office box number for PO box addresses.

label.name: Address locality
label.description: The name of the city, town, municipality, village, ... The locality in which the street address is, and which is in the region. For example which city, Mountain View.

label.name: Address Region
label.description: State, province, .. The region in which the locality is, and which is in the country. For example, California or another appropriate first-level Administrative division.

label.name: Postal/zip code
label.description: The postal code. For example, 94043.

label.name: Country
label.description: The country. For example, USA. You can also provide the two-letter ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code.

label.name: Disposition
label.description: The current state of a specimen with respect to a collection.

label.name: Sampling date (range) and time (range)
label.description: Represents an historic date (range) of sampling accepting date/time range expressions in the formats acceptedby the CA TimeExpressionParser module.

label.name: Preparation Date
label.description: The date of preparation/extraction. Date the object was created.

label.name: Seedlot relation
label.description: The relation between the individual seeds of the seedlot

label.name: Seedlot relation
label.description: The relation between the individual seeds of the seedlot

label.name: Relation specification
label.description: Specification on the type of relation.

label.name: Decomposition category
label.description: Decomposition category of the organism at the time of sampling. DCC1: extremely fresh (e.g. animal/plant was still alive at collection, or the animal was euthanized and collection occurred immediately after). DCC2: fresh (i.e. animal that has only recently died, no signs of decomposition / the collected leaves were fallen off the tree but still green). DCC3: moderate decomposition (for example: mammal its belly is swollen, hair detaches, fly eggs, .. / leaves start to turn brown). DCC4: advanced decomposition (for example: mammal its belly is swollen, hair detaches, maggots, ... / leaves are completely brown). DCC5: mummified (animal is (partly) decomposed).

label.name: Realtionships to non-INBO specimen(s)
label.description: The specimen is related to a external specimen = a specimen held at another Natural Science collection; as specified.

label.name: Resource URI
label.description: A preferably resolvable URI to uniquely identify the related specimen, not held in the INBO collection. For example a DOI-url.

label.name: External specimen ID
label.description: Identifier of the external specimen

label.name: External specimen description
label.description: Identifier of the external specimen

label.name: Type of relationship with the external specimen
Relation specification
label.description: Specification on the type of relation.

label.name: Start date of the forest tree population type label
End date of the forest tree population type label
Reference number of the forest tree population (e.g. PAV-KL-01-01)
Any remaining relevant information on the Forest tree population category
sex (dwc:sex)
label.description: The sex of the biological individual(s) represented in the Occurrence.

label.name: sex (dwc:sex)
label.description: The sex of the biological individual(s) represented in the Occurrence.

label.name: lifeStage animal
label.description: The age class or life stage of the biological individual(s) at the time the Occurrence was recorded.

label.name: lifeStage animal
label.description: The age class or life stage of the biological individual(s) at the time the Occurrence was recorded.

label.name: lifeStage animal
label.description: The age class or life stage of the biological individual(s) at the time the Occurrence was recorded.

label.name: lifeStage animal
label.description: The age class or life stage of the biological individual(s) at the time the Occurrence was recorded.

label.name: lifeStage animal
label.description: The age class or life stage of the biological individual(s) at the time the Occurrence was recorded.

label.name: lifeStage plant
label.description: The age class or life stage of the biological individual(s) at the time the Occurrence was recorded.

label.name: reproductiveCondition
label.description: The reproductive condition of the biological individual(s) represented in the Occurrence. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

label.name: reproductiveCondition
label.description: The reproductive condition of the biological individual(s) represented in the Occurrence. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

label.name: DNA concentration measurement
label.description: A measurement of DNA concentration. Multiple measurements are possible, at different dates or by different people.

label.name: Date (range) and time (range)
label.description: Represents an historic date range accepting date/time range expressions in the formats acceptedby the CA TimeExpressionParser module.

label.name: DNA concentration
label.description: Concentration of DNA.

label.name: Unit of Concentration (DNA)
label.description: Unit used for concentration measurement (DNA).

label.name: Published procedure
label.description: Procedure doi if published, such as in an article, a standardized opering procedure (SOP)

label.name: DNA concentration procedure
label.description: Description of the measurement procedure.

label.name: measurementAccuracy
label.description: The description of the potential error associated with the measurementValue.

label.name: Remarks
label.description: Any relevant remaining remarks on the measurement. This could be who did the measurement, if something unusual was observed during the measurement,...

label.name: DNA ratio of absorbance measurement
label.description: A measurement of the ratio of absorbance. Multiple measurements are possible, at different dates.

label.name: Date (range) and time (range)
label.description: Represents an historic date range accepting date/time range expressions in the formats acceptedby the CA TimeExpressionParser module.

label.name: ratioOfAbsorbance260230
label.description: Ratio of absorbance at 280 nm and 230 nm assessing DNA purity (mostly secondary measure, indicates mainly EDTA, carbohydrates, phenol), (DNA samples only).

label.name: ratioOfAbsorbance260280
label.description: Ratio of absorbance at 280 nm and 230 nm assessing DNA purity (mostly secondary measure, indicates mainly EDTA, carbohydrates, phenol), (DNA samples only).

label.name: Published procedure
label.description: Procedure doi if published, such as in an article, a standardized opering procedure (SOP)

label.name: Procedure
label.description: Description of the measurement procedure

label.name: measurementAccuracy
label.description: The description of the potential error associated with the measurementValue.

label.name: Remarks
label.description: Any relevant remaining remarks on the measurement. This could be who did the measurement, if something unusual was observed during the measurement,...

label.name: Date (range) and time (range)
label.description: Represents an historic date range accepting date/time range expressions in the formats acceptedby the CA TimeExpressionParser module.

label.name: fragmentLength
label.description: Length of fragments (on average or precise)

label.name: Percent above 9KB Threshold
label.description: Percent of your DNA at or above the size of the 9KB threshold. E.g.: 10%, 35%, 50%, 80%. Usually a protocol considers 50% of fragments 9KB to be high genomic quality.

label.name: Gel Duration
label.description: Duration of Gel

label.name: Gel Ladder
label.description: A Gel Ladder is a combination of various known-length fragments of DNA or RNA used to measure DNA or RNA fragments of unknown lengths.

label.name: Published procedure
label.description: Procedure doi if published, such as in an article, a standardized opering procedure (SOP)

label.name: Procedure
label.description: Description of the measurment procedure.

label.name: measurementAccuracy
label.description: The description of the potential error associated with the measurementValue.

label.name: Remarks
label.description: Any relevant remaining remarks on the measurement. This could be who did the measurement, if something unusual was observed during the measurement,...

label.name: Date (range) and time (range)
label.description: Represents an historic date range accepting date/time range expressions in the formats acceptedby the CA TimeExpressionParser module.

label.name: Volume
label.description: Volume of sample

label.name: Unit of Volume
label.description: Unit used for volume measurement.

label.name: Published procedure
label.description: Procedure doi if published, such as in an article, a standardized opering procedure (SOP)

label.name: Procedure
label.description: Description of the measurement procedure.

label.name: Accuracy
label.description: The description of the potential error associated with the measurementValue.

label.name: Remarks
label.description: Any relevant remaining remarks on the measurement. This could be who did the measurement, if something unusual was observed during the measurement,...

label.name: Date (range) and time (range)
label.description: Represents an historic date range accepting date/time range expressions in the formats acceptedby the CA TimeExpressionParser module.

label.name: measurementAppliesTo
label.description: Further specification of what exactly was measured. For example: volume.. of water that ran through the water filter, volume.. of lysis buffer that was retained.

label.name: Volume
label.description: Volume of sample

label.name: Unit
label.description: Unit used for measurement.

label.name: Published procedure
label.description: Procedure doi if published, such as in an article, a standardized opering procedure (SOP)

label.name: Procedure
label.description: Description of the measurement procedure.

label.name: measurementAccuracy
label.description: The description of the potential error associated with the measurementValue.

label.name: Remarks
label.description: Any relevant remaining remarks on the measurement. This could be who did the measurement, if something unusual was observed during the measurement,...

label.name: Date (range) and time (range)
label.description: Represents an historic date range accepting date/time range expressions in the formats acceptedby the CA TimeExpressionParser module.

label.name: measurementAppliesTo
label.description: Further specification of what exactly was measured. For example: bruto or netto weight.

label.name: Lower value
label.description: Weight value

label.name: Unit
label.description: Unit used for the weight measurement.

label.name: Accuracy
label.description: The description of the potential error associated with the measurementValue.

label.name: Published procedure
label.description: Procedure doi if published, such as in an article, a standardized opering procedure (SOP)

label.name: Procedure
label.description: Description of the measurement procedure.

label.name: Remarks
label.description: Any relevant remaining remarks on the measurement. This could be who did the measurement, if something unusual was observed during the measurement,... For weight measurements this can be a text value expressing the weight, if no actual numeric value is present, e.g. "too low to measure".

label.name: Date (range) and time (range)
label.description: Represents an historic date range accepting date/time range expressions in the formats acceptedby the CA TimeExpressionParser module.

label.name: measurementAppliesTo
label.description: Further specification of what exactly was measured. For example: length/width: "of the arm/leg/tail". For example: diameter: "of the main trunk".

label.name: Unit
label.description: Unit used for the measurement.

label.name: Lower value
label.description: Lower or only value

label.name: Accuracy
label.description: The description of the potential error associated with the measurementValue.

label.name: Published procedure
label.description: Procedure doi if published, such as in an article, a standardized opering procedure (SOP)

label.name: Procedure
label.description: Description of the measurement procedure.

label.name: Remarks
label.description: Any relevant remaining remarks on the measurement. This could be who did the measurement, if something unusual was observed during the measurement,...

label.name: Date (range) and time (range)
label.description: Represents an historic date range accepting date/time range expressions in the formats acceptedby the CA TimeExpressionParser module.

label.name: Accuracy
label.description: The description of the potential error associated with the measurementValue.

label.name: Lower value
label.description: Lower or only value

label.name: Unit
label.description: Unit used for the measurement.

label.name: Published procedure
label.description: Procedure doi if published, such as in an article, a standardized opering procedure (SOP)

label.name: Procedure
label.description: Description of the measurement procedure.

label.name: Remarks
label.description: Any relevant remaining remarks on the measurement. This could be who did the measurement, if something unusual was observed during the measurement,... For age measurements this can be a text value expressing the age, e.g. "estimated to be younger than five", which could be complemented by the minimum value 0 and the maximum value 5.

label.name: Date (range) and time (range)
label.description: Represents an historic date range accepting date/time range expressions in the formats acceptedby the CA TimeExpressionParser module.

label.name: Accuracy
label.description: The description of the potential error associated with the measurementValue.

label.name: Lower value
label.description: Lower or only value

label.name: Unit
label.description: Unit used for the measurement.

label.name: Published procedure
label.description: Procedure doi if published, such as in an article, a standardized opering procedure (SOP)

label.name: Procedure
label.description: Description of the measurement procedure.

label.name: Remarks
label.description: Any relevant remaining remarks on the measurement. This could be who did the measurement, if something unusual was observed during the measurement,... For age measurements this can be a text value expressing the age, e.g. "estimated to be younger than five", which could be complemented by the minimum value 0 and the maximum value 5.

label.name: Date (range) and time (range)
label.description: Represents an historic date range accepting date/time range expressions in the formats acceptedby the CA TimeExpressionParser module.

label.name: Accuracy
label.description: The description of the potential error associated with the measurementValue.

label.name: Lower value
label.description: Lower or only value

label.name: Unit
label.description: Unit used for the measurement

label.name: Published procedure
label.description: Procedure doi if published, such as in an article, a standardized opering procedure (SOP)

label.name: Procedure
label.description: Description of the measurement procedure.

label.name: Remarks
label.description: Any relevant remaining remarks on the measurement. This could be who did the measurement, if something unusual was observed during the measurement,... For age measurements this can be a text value expressing the age, e.g. "estimated to be younger than five", which could be complemented by the minimum value 0 and the maximum value 5.

label.name: Date (range) and time (range)
label.description: Represents an historic date range accepting date/time range expressions in the formats acceptedby the CA TimeExpressionParser module.

label.name: Accuracy
label.description: The description of the potential error associated with the measurementValue. Can also include words such as: about, approximately, ..

label.name: Lower value
label.description: Lower or only value

label.name: Unit
label.description: Unit used for the measurement.

label.name: measurementAppliesTo
label.description: Further specification of what exactly was counted. For example: seeds, hairs, nodes, parasites, ...

label.name: Published procedure
label.description: Procedure doi if published, such as in an article, a standardized opering procedure (SOP)

label.name: Procedure
label.description: Description of the measurement procedure.

label.name: Remarks
label.description: Any relevant remaining remarks on the measurement. This could be who did the measurement, if something unusual was observed during the measurement,... For age measurements this can be a text value expressing the age, e.g. "estimated to be younger than five", which could be complemented by the minimum value 0 and the maximum value 5.

label.name: verbatimLocality
label.description: The original textual description of the place.

label.name: provenance
label.description: Refers to the source of the plant material that was collected for propagation. This does not equal the sampling locality if this is material that been propagated ex situ.

label.name: Verbatim Latitude (Y)
label.description: A free text format for the latitude component of the coordinates, as they were originally recorded / noted down.

label.name: Verbatim Longitude (X)
label.description: A free text format for the longitude component of the coordinates, as they were originally recorded / noted down.

label.name: Verbatim Geodetic Datum
label.description: The ellipsoid, geodetic datum, or spatial reference system (SRS) upon which the geographic coordinates given in verbatimLatitude and verbatimLongitude are based.

label.name: Georeference verification status
label.description: A categorical description of the extent to which the georeference has been verified to represent the best possible spatial description.

label.name: verbatimcoordinatesRemarks
label.description: Any additional information to help correctly georeference the verbatim coordinates such as coordinate system, measurement method, notes taken in the field, ...

label.name: verbatimElevation
label.description: The original description of the elevation (altitude, usually above sea level) of the Location.

label.name: locationID
label.description: An identifier for the set of dcterms:Location information. May be a global unique identifier or an identifier specific to the data set.

label.name: decimalLatitude
label.description: The geographic latitude (in decimal degrees, using the spatial reference system given in dwc:geodeticDatum) of the geographic center of a dcterms:Location. Positive values are north of the Equator, negative values are south of it. Legal values lie between -90 and 90, inclusive.

label.name: decimalLongitude
label.description: The geographic longitude (in decimal degrees, using the spatial reference system given in dwc:geodeticDatum) of the geographic center of a dcterms:Location. Positive values are east of the Greenwich Meridian, negative values are west of it. Legal values lie between -180 and 180, inclusive.

label.name: coordinateUncertaintyInMeters
label.description: The horizontal distance (in meters) from the given dwc:decimalLatitude and dwc:decimalLongitude describing the smallest circle containing the whole of the dcterms:Location. Leave the value empty if the uncertainty is unknown, cannot be estimated, or is not applicable (because there are no coordinates). Zero is not a valid value for this term.

label.name: geodeticDatum
label.description: The ellipsoid, geodetic datum, or spatial reference system (SRS) upon which the geographic coordinates given in dwc:decimalLatitude and dwc:decimalLongitude are based.

label.name: coordinatePrecision
label.description: A decimal representation of the precision of the coordinates given in the dwc:decimalLatitude and dwc:decimalLongitude. 0.00001 (normal GPS limit for decimal degrees); 0.000278 (nearest second); 0.01667 (nearest minute); 1.0 (nearest degree)

label.name: pointRadiusSpatialFit
label.description: The ratio of the area of the point-radius (dwc:decimalLatitude, dwc:decimalLongitude, dwc:coordinateUncertaintyInMeters) to the area of the true (original, or most specific) spatial representation of the dcterms:Location. Legal values are 0, greater than or equal to 1, or undefined. A value of 1 is an exact match or 100% overlap.

label.name: georeferenceProtocol
label.description: A description or reference to the methods used to determine the spatial footprint, coordinates, and uncertainties.

label.name: georeferenceSources
label.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of maps, gazetteers, or other resources used to georeference the dcterms:Location, described specifically enough to allow anyone in the future to use the same resources.

label.name: locality
label.description: The specific description of the place.

label.name: georeferenceRemarks
label.description: Notes or comments about the spatial description determination, explaining assumptions made in addition or opposition to the those formalized in the method referred to in dwc:georeferenceProtocol.

label.name: minimumElevationInMeters
label.description: The lower limit of the range of elevation (altitude, usually above sea level), in meters.

label.name: maximumElevationInMeters
label.description: The upper limit of the range of elevation (altitude, usually above sea level), in meters.

label.name: verticalDatum
label.description: The vertical datum used as the reference upon which the values in the elevation terms are based.

label.name: verbatimDepth
label.description: The original description of the depth below the local surface.

label.name: minimumDepthInMeters
label.description: The lesser depth of a range of depth below the local surface, in meters.

label.name: maximumDepthInMeters
label.description: The greater depth of a range of depth below the local surface, in meters.

label.name: verbatimHeight
label.description: The original description of the height above the local surface.

label.name: minimumHeightInMeters
label.description: The lower limit of the range of height in meters.

label.name: maximumHeightInMeters
label.description: The upper limit of the range of height in meters.

label.name: habitat
label.description: A category or description of the habitat in which the Event occurred.

label.name: Verbatim taxonomic identification
label.description: Taxonomic identification of the specimen, to the lowest level possible. This can be species name in any language, genus, family, ...

label.name: Standardized taxonomic identification
label.description: Link to an URL of the (closest match) taxon in a central repository such as Catalogue of Life (CoL). CoL records have the format: https://www.catalogueoflife.org/data/taxon/595F4.

label.name: Date of taxonomic identification
label.description: It is generally assumed that the most recent identification, is the correct identification.

label.name: Notes on the taxonomic identification
label.description: Any notes such as expressions of uncertainty (or certainty), methods (did you use an ID key), mismatch or match with Catalogue of life, ..

label.name: ID container
label.description: Identification container

label.name: Reference database
label.description: An URL that leads to a snapshot of the reference database used at the time of taxonomic identification.

label.name: Date of taxonomic identification
label.description: It is generally assumed that the most recent identification, is the correct identification.

label.name: verbatimIdentification
label.description: Identification of the specimen, to the lowest level possible. This can be species name in any language, genus, family, ...

label.name: Standardized identification
label.description: Link to an URL of the (closest match) taxon in a central repository such as Catalogue of Life (CoL). CoL records have the format: https://www.catalogueoflife.org/data/taxon/595F4.

label.name: Notes on the ID
label.description: Any notes such as expressions of uncertainty (or certainty), methods (did you use an ID key), mismatch or match with Catalogue of life, ..

label.name: samplingProtocol
label.description: The methods or protocols used during a sampling event.

label.name: Sampling protocol DOI
label.description: A preferably resolvable URI to uniquely identify the sampling procedure. For example a DOI-url.

label.name: Sampling protocol details
label.description: If no DOI in "Sampling protocol DOI": a short description or code that allows validation of the used procedure. If DOI in "sampling DOI" this field can be used to log relevant extra information e.g. deviation of the standard procedure.

label.name: sampling protocol (url)
label.description: The methods or protocols used during a sampling event, published.

label.name: samplingEffort
label.description: The amount of effort expended during an Event.

label.name: Event date (range) and time (range)
label.description: Represents an historic date (range) of an event. Accepting date/time range expressions in the formats acceptedby the CA TimeExpressionParser module.

label.name: Event Procedure
label.description: Description of the procedure. Could be including relevant URLs.

label.name: Valuation specification
label.description: Further specification, remarks on the object value.

label.name: Curation result
label.description: A further specification of the curation action. For example: type: renewal -> renewal of the container to aluminum pouch.

label.name: Admin
label.description: An URL that can be used to link documents saved in the google workspace to records (objects, object lots, loans, ..).

label.name: obligationdeadline
label.description: Specify if there is a deadline. Examples: "2026", "2026-12-12", "no deadline", "asap".

label.name: Obligation status
label.description: Status of meeting the given obligation

label.name: statusDate
label.description: Date at which current status was achieved.

label.name: obligationDocumentation
label.description: File that proves that the obligation was met.

label.name: Data export
label.description: Actions to undertake to make the shared data less specific or complete than in its original form. Please do report as specific as possible in this database, and leave instructions on what action to undertake for open data publication.

label.name: Data export specification
label.description: A valid reason for not publishing parts of the data open must be described here. If no reason is given, the data is exported as such. Valid reasons are: contains personal data without consent to publish, protected species, on private property with negative consequences for the owners, ...

label.name: Blocked Until
label.description: Sample or specimen data can not be ordered/loaned until the given date, but are visible via portals

label.name: Restrictions in use of the Natural Science object
Further specification of the affiliation, substructure of the organization the individual belongs to (e.g. Department, Research group, Team, ...)
Role Started At Time
label.description: The date or time when a Person started fulfilling the role specified in the role property.

label.name: Role ended At Time
label.description: The date or time when a Person stopped fulfilling the role specified in the role property.

label.name: Organisational Unit Name
label.description: An official name of the organisational unit in the local language.

label.name: Loan status
label.description: Indication if the loan is still open or concluded.

label.name: Authorization date
label.description: The date when the loan was authorized.

label.name: Loan in date
label.description: The date a loan will enter the institution.

label.name: Loan out date
label.description: The date a loan will enter the institution.

label.name: Loan return date
label.description: The date a loan is due back to the lending institution.

label.name: Loan renewal application date
label.description: The date to apply for a renewal to the loan.

label.name: Loan conditions
label.description: A statement of the conditions on a loan.

label.name: Loan note
label.description: General information about the loan.

label.name: Loan purpose
label.description: General information about the purpose of loan.

label.name: Set description
label.description: Narrative description for set.

label.name: Set item description
label.description: Narrative description for item in this set.

label.name: Collection's basis of scheme (ltc:basisOfScheme)
label.description: A summary of the basis or purpose for the CollectionDescriptionScheme. A CollectionDescriptionScheme is a grouping of multiple ObjectGroups for a particular use case, purpose or implementation.

label.name: Collection's scheme name (ltc:schemeName)
label.description: A short descriptive name given to the CollectionDescriptionScheme.

label.name: Collection's objects are disctinct (ltc:distinctObjects)
label.description: A flag to designate whether a physical object may be described by more than one ObjectGroup within the CollectionDescriptionScheme.

label.name: Collection's access conditions (ltc:conditionsOfAccess)
label.description: Information about who can access the collection being described or an indication of its security status. If available, this should be a URL to a stable policy page.

label.name: Collection date container
label.description: Information on the collection concept it's timeline

label.name: Current collection
label.description: A flag to indicate whether the collection still exists as a single entity (ltc:currentCollection).

label.name: Collection Concept start date
label.description: Accepting date/time range expressions in the formats acceptedby the CA TimeExpressionParser module.

label.name: Collection concept end date
label.description: Accepting date/time range expressions in the formats acceptedby the CA TimeExpressionParser module.

label.name: Collection has type specimens (ltc:knownToContainTypes)
label.description: Flag property to indicate that the collection is known to include type specimens.

label.name: Collection's discipline(s) (ltc:discipline)
label.description: A high level classification of the scientific discipline to which the objects within the collection belong or are related.

label.name: Collection's object type(s) (ltc:objectType)
label.description: High-level terms for the classification of curated objects.

label.name: Collection's preservation method(s) (ltc:preservationMethod)
label.description: A term used to classify or describe an object that indicates the primary or most recent action, measure or process that has been used in order to preserve the objects in the collection for long-term storage.

label.name: Collection's dwc:degreeOfEstablishment
label.description: The degree to which an organism survives, reproduces, and expands its range at the given place and time.

label.name: Temporal Coverage Type
label.description: The type or context of the time range associated with the collection's establishment. Separate from the living or geologic periods represented by the objects in the collection.

label.name: Temporal Coverage Start Date
label.description: Start date of the time range of the collection.

label.name: Temporal Coverage End Date
label.description: End date of the time range of the collection.

settings.setting: This is a unique identifier for the record, automatically assigned by the system.

This is the preferred identifier. For (non-living) objects in an INBO collection this identifier has to be physically present on/with the object, on the label or written on the object. For naming conventions, please contact the manager of the INBO-subcollection your specimen belongs to. Example for DNA-samples: 19-009625 (LIMS-ID). Example for mammal tissue samples: da1488tong2. Example for seedlots: seedlot_ALNUS_GLU-000-156. For soil samples this is the Specimen ID (SID). If not part of an INBO-collection: please use the (field) ID you gave the specimen and add the prefix: "year_projectShortID_" and the suffix "_objectConcept". For example: if you collected samples of crayfish in the field and numbered them incrementally: "124" will most likely not be an unique value in the full database of all the INBO-generated sampling points and specimens. Hence it is changed into: 2024_Craywatch_149_crayfish for the entire collected animal, and 2024_Craywatch_149_muscle for the collected muscle tissue and 2024_Craywatch_149_leg for the collected leg. Later on a DNA specimen can be generated from (parts of) the tissues which will be named according to the convention of that INBO subcollection e.g. 24-000978.
The object published on DiSSCo, occurrence data of the sampling point published on GBIF,.. This is a sister-record of the current digital record of the specimen or sampling point.
Over time the same forest tree population can be appointed a different type.

This is the date/time that becomes fixed due to sampling the sampling point to its first object. The format can be a date (2023-08-03), a month (2023-08), a year (2023); a range (2020-2023). Mandatory field.

This is the date/time that the specimen/object was created. When this is the first object in the hierarchy, this date equals the sampling date. When this a second or third object in the sequence, it will differ (e.g. a DNA sample is created on a later date than the sampling of the tissue sample). The format can be a date (2023-08-03), a month (2023-08), a year (2023); a range (2020-2023). Mandatory field.
The original description of the depth of sampling
The minimum sampling depth in meters *
The maximum sampling depth in meters *
If more options in the list are needed, please select "other" and contact the CMS manager.
Genotype(s). For a single object: new genotypes can be added over time. For bulk samples (e.g. forest tree populations): different genotypes can be listed.
A flag indicating whether the object is deaccessioned
Will be 1 when deaccessioned or 0 (the default) when not deaccessioned. This should be visible in the object curation log. Types of deaccesioning are: disposal or transfer.
This allows a description of the storage location of the plant (plot), free text.
The original description of the longitude (X) of the storage location.
The original description of the latitude (Y) of the storage location..
Map representation of the storage location
Multiple points can be entered to visualize the different individuals in a plot.
The relationship between sampling point and all the directly related objects (subsamples, DNA-extractions, parasites from cadaver, ...). TIP: to view sibling specimens, move to the parent specimen.
Associations between INBO-specimen. For example: host and parasite, host plant and butterfly egg, ...
Relation of the seeds in the seedlot
Specimen belongs to specimen lot (only 1 entry allowed)
Add relationship to an external specimen
Original project that generated the record
This can be a project as defined in JIRA, a project as defined in LIMS, ..
Field campaign of which the record is a result

Field campaign can be an expedition, a survey event, one day in the field, one hour in the field... The field campaign can be nested (and relevant to document), e.g. during an expedition you visited different localities with different crew; link the object to the smallest unit of time.
Over time the same forest tree population can have a different type.
This is the date/time that becomes fixed due to sampling. The format can be a date (2023-08-03), a month (2023-08), a year (2023); a range (2020-2023). Mandatory field.
A person that sampled/collected the object/specimen.

This is the date/time that the specimen/object was created/extracted/prepared. When this is the first object in the hierarchy, this date equals the sampling date. When this a second or third object in the sequence (e.g. a DNA sample is created on a later date than the sampling of the tissue sample), this date will differ from the sampling date. The format can be a date (2023-08-03), a month (2023-08), a year (2023); a range (2020-2023). Mandatory field.

A person that created/extracted/prepared the object/specimen. When this is the first object in the hierarchy, this person(s) equal(s) the collectors. When this a second or third object in the hierarchy of objects (e.g. a DNA sample is created on a later date than the sampling of the tissue sample), this person(s) can differ from the collector(s).

Any relevant unstructured information on the object (e.g. notes, comments) literally transcribed from the original source (e.g. paper inventory, field notes). Tip: under the screen "Multimedia and files" you can link any relevant field files, photos, ...
Text field to (concisely) describe the procedure (if relevant).
Verbatim locality of the sampling point
The original description of athe locality, a place, the geographic coverage/range, ... of the sampling point.
Verbatim longitude (X) of the sampling point
The original description of the longitude (X) of the sampling point.
Verbatim latitude (Y) of the sampling point.
The original description of the latitude (Y) of the sampling point.
The geodetic datum of the verbatim coordinates of the sampling point.
Remarks on the locality / coordinates of the sampling point as originally recorded.
Please enter [decimalLatitidueX,decimalLongitudeY]. This will allow to execute map searches within the INBO-CMS.

The map above is checked: do the decimal coordinates deliver the correct locality? Additional information below is entered, by using the tool: https://geopick.gbif.org/. The most precise placename is linked to the specimen.
As given by the georeference tool (e.g. https://geopick.gbif.org/)
A person (other than the collectors) that georeferenced the object/specimen (e.g. by using https://geopick.gbif.org/).

The place or toponym, chosen from the standardized list. TIP: Always interpret the place name in the historical context! For example municipalities can fuse or split. Each place attribution has a reference and time stamp.
The place or toponym, chosen from the standardized list. This view allows you to browse through the available options already available. To add an option, use the "lookup" above.
The plant sampling point has the provenance. As provenance concepts are dependent on the taxon, these are logged separately.
The original description of the elevation. From the notes, Excel/Gsheet, dataset, ...
The vertical datum used as the reference upon which the values in the elevation terms are based.
The original description of the depth of sampling
The minimum sampling depth in meters
The maximum sampling depth in meters
The original description of the height of sampling on the plant.
The minimum sampling height in meters
The maximum sampling height in meters.
Published dataset of the environmental biodiversity (absence/presence)

The DNA concentration allows to estimate how much DNA is present in the buffer (depends on the volume). This is a measure of quantity. Concentration is commonly measured usuing fluorometry, for example with a Qubit; or in capillary gels such as those present in the BioAnalyzer or FragmentAnalyzer.
Using spectrophotometry DNA ratio of absorbance (230/260 and 260/280) is measured. This is a measure of quality. Spectrophotometry measurements are commonly executed with a Nanodrop.
This can be a classic agarose gel, or a capillary gel in e.g. in the BioAnalyzer or Fragment analyzer.

This can be an exact measurement of volume, or derived measurement volume. This allows to track the volume through time. Example of the latter: we started with 100 L and we took out 20 L - hence the new "measured" volume is 80 L.
Decomposition category of the animal(s) at the time of sampling

DCC1: extremely fresh (e.g. animal was still alive at collection, or the animal was euthanized and collection occurred immediately after). DCC2: fresh (i.e. animal that has only recently died, no signs of decomposition). DCC3: moderate decomposition (for example: mammal its belly is swollen, hair detaches, fly eggs, ..). DCC4: advanced decomposition (for example: mammal its belly is swollen, hair detaches, maggots, ...). DCC5: mummified (animal is (partly) decomposed).
If more options in the list are needed, please select "other" and contact the CMS manager.
It is possible that a plant or animal (and its derived objects) are genotyped by different genetic markers, new genotypes can be added over time.
Due to sampling, the life stage of the animal at time object(s) were collected becomes a fixed value.
Due to sampling, the life stage of the animal at time object(s) were collected becomes a fixed value.
Due to sampling, the life stage of the animal at time object(s) were collected becomes a fixed value.
Due to sampling, the life stage of the animal at time object(s) were collected becomes a fixed value.
Due to sampling, the life stage of the animal at time object(s) were collected becomes a fixed value.
Due to sampling, the life stage of the plant at time object(s) were collected becomes a fixed value.

Explanation to list options: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1jprv5wpYa5kXPDQDO_qvCb2YtCHTjOgFkpbWXQGwLgg/edit#gid=0. If more options in the list are needed, please select "other" and contact the CMS manager.
Reproductive condition of the mammal at time object(s) were collected
Reproductive condition of the organism at time object(s) were collected

Add URL and describe what the (multimedia) file represents. For example: it represents the living animal from which a toe clip was sampled. For example: it represents the toe clip sample in a cryotube. For example: it is a scan of the experimental plot outline.

A relevant URL of a (data) publication that is directly or indirectly linked to the object/specimen or the sampling point the specimen represents. This could be datasets on GBIF, Zenodo, Genbank - related to the specimen. This could be any type of publications such as A1 pulications, GIS-layers, ..
Indication of the quality of the object record
A flag indicating whether the object is deaccessioned

Will be 1 when deaccessioned or 0 (the default) when not deaccessioned. This should be visible in the object curation log. If the object is not existing anymore (dead, consumed, disposed of, ...) or if the ownership is not of INBO anymore (transferred), the object is deaccessionned. This means that we no longer have it in the INBO-collection.
Person or organization that owns the land on which forest tree population grows.
Responsible person or organization for the maintenance of the forest tree population.
This can be both an individual (i.e. personal collection that was donated) or organization.

A person (preferably working at INBO) that can be contacted in case more information on the object is asked, or needed. Ideally this is at least one person from within INBO, and optionally a second (external) contact can be listed. Better would be that all information is recorded in the database, so a contact person becomes unnecessary.

The event of someone evaluating the object resulting in a measure of value for that object. The value can differ through time and through the eye of the beholder. The valuation event in this context exists of a standardized list of value types, and the possibility to add more information to why this value was chosen.

Curation = the action or process of selecting, organizing, and looking after the items in a collection or exhibition. Examples: repacking the object, adding a new label, adding new buffer, a cold/heat treatment,...
Re-use of the object is blocked until this date
The object or a subsample of the object is loaned or donated
The object was (partly) (re-)used in the projects.
This is a unique identifier for the record, automatically assigned by the INBO-CMS.
A relevant URL of a publication that is directly or indirectly linked to the genotype.
Add URL and describe what the (multimedia) file represents. In the case of a genotype, this could be a scan of documents that are relevant for defining the genotype.

The field campaign name used in notes, datasets, publications, ... if there are multiple names or identifiers for the field campaign, all other identifiers are put in the "non-preferred labels" below.

The project name used in notes, datasets, publications, ... if there are multiple names or identifiers for the project, all other identifiers (e.g. JIRA URL) are put in the "non-preferred labels" below.
The identifier for the curation event used in notes. This can be a descriptive title: for example: Renewal of seedlot bags 2023.
For example: the project-URL in JIRA
The original description of a locality, a place, the geographic coverage, ...
The field campaign or project took place at. This can compass administrational places but also plots or transects.

Here you can specify further on the curation action. For example: disposal because of depletion of DNA/soil, disease (plant), rot (seedlot), ...; treatment: cold treatment -80C for parasites; renewal: of containers, of labels, of buffer + in the file you can specify the manufacturers information on the new mateiral.; reason why this particular group of samples was transferred.
The project or field campaign can be put into the context.
Description of the project or field campaign.
Object that was subjected to the event (identification, valuation or curation)
Text field to (concisely) describe the procedure (if relevant). Can be if: no doi-reference for procedure description or to add notes/addenda on the given published procedure.
For example: if the field campaign is focussed on populations: "sampled until 30 samples of population/locality was reached".

Here you can specify further on the curation action. For example: disposal because of depletion of DNA/soil, disease (plant), rot (seedlot), ...; treatment: cold treatment -80C for parasites; renewal: of containers, of labels, of buffer + in the file you can specify the manufacturers information on the new mateiral.; reason why this particular group of samples was transferred.
Organization to which the samples were transferred
File associated with field campaign or project that specifies conditions for usage of objects or associated data. For example: a scan of a permit.
For individuals: ORCID. For organizations: ROR. For both: WikiData.
Organization to which the individual is affiliated.
This can be substructure of the organization the individual belongs to (e.g. Department, Research group, Team, ...)
For example: Getty Thesaurus of Geographic Names - see: https://www.getty.edu/research/tools/vocabularies/tgn/.
Visual representation of the place. Most relevant for in-situ plot or transect (e.g. (publication that contains) map, sketch)
Object that belongs to the in-situ plot or transect
File associated with place that specifies conditions for executing research or entering a certain place.
Obligations resulting from administration. For example: asking permission x-days behorehand.
ltc:collectionName: A short title that summarises the collection objects contained within the ObjectGroup.
For example, the collection on the Global Registry of Scientific Collections. See: https://www.gbif.org/grscicoll.
Degree of establishment as characteristic of the collection
Some preserved collections are specifically created from cultivated or captive organisms, or perhaps from rare vagrants.
Habitat as characteristic of the collection
The overall habitat represented by the collection.
Sampling protocol as distinguising characteristic of the collection
The name of, reference to, or description of the method or protocol used to gather objects in the collection.
Collection linked to a specific field campaign
If the defined collection is specifically linked to a defined field campaign, enter here.
Taxonomic concept as characteristic of the collection
The taxonomic scope of the collection. Use the common denominator of the object group, or add multiple relevant 'tags'.
Temporal concept as characteristic of the collection
The temporal scope of the collection.

The collection manager is an INBO-scientist that is knowledgable on the specimens of the collection it manages, its applications and its management. This person has the responsibility for the collection management.

The assistant collection manager is an INBO-scientist that assists the collection manager. This could be assistance in making decisions (on how to manage, what to loan, ..); assistance in representing the collection at meetings or assistance in collection management documentation. This person does not have the end responsibility for the collection.

The collection archivist manages the physical collection. He/She is responsible that the physical collection is properly monitored and he/she keeps the collection manager informed. This role has the end responsibility considering accessioning new specimen, retrieving specimen for loans, label quality monitoring, monitoring correct logging of the storage location, ...

The assistant archivist helps the archivist manage the physical collection. He/She does not have an end responsibility, but is allowed to assist/help or take over the work of the archivist in his/her absence (e.g. illness).

The collection steward is responsible for handling loan administration, reporting on the collections and manageing the joint (quality) documentation of the different collections. He/she also oversees data quality in the INBO-CMS database.
Smallest possible storage location that withholds the full collection

This is preferrably an organization. Best practice is that if personal collections are used for research purposes, a duplicate of the object or the collection (object) as a whole is donated. This is either the current owner, or the last owner if disposed.
The XY information on where the box can be found in the crate or rack.
Preservation temperature of the cabinet, fridge or freezer.
Responsible person for maintenance of the storage space or the forest tree population site.
This (google drive) link brings you to relevant multimedia (pictures, videos, ..) of this storage unit.
This could be a document describing the storage space, giving technical information, ...
A description of the object lot.
Link to documents (e.g., contracts, mails) linked to the object lot
Original project that generated the object lot
This can be a project as defined in JIRA, a project as defined in LIMS, ..
Field campaign of which the object lot is a result

Field campaign can be an expedition, a survey event, one day in the field, one hour in the field... The field campaign can be nested (and relevant to document), e.g. during an expedition you visited different localities with different crew; link the object to the smallest unit of time.
Object that belongs to the object lot
An URL that leads to multimedia LINKED TO THE OBJECT LOT (i.e. not the sampling point, nor the objects within the object lot).

A relevant URL that refers to the object/specimen. This can be an internal INBO document on the Google drive, a published or unpublished dataset, a link to an INBO database (use the INBO datacatalogue),..

A person that can be contacted in case more information on the object lot is asked, or needed. Ideally this is at least one person from within INBO, and optionally a second (external) contact can be listed. Better would be that all information is recorded in the database, so a contact person becomes unnecessary.

The event of someone evaluating the object lot resulting in a measure of value for that object. The value can differ through time and through the eye of the beholder. The valuation event in this context exists of a standardized list of value types, and the possibility to add more information to why this value was chosen.

Curation = the action or process of selecting, organizing, and looking after the items in a collection or exhibition. Examples: repacking the object, adding a new label, adding new buffer, a cold/heat treatment,...

Every loan needs a secondary individual that is registered as a back-up contact. All communication occurs with the requestor and the back-up in cc. This is implemented in case the first individual cannot be reached or becomes disassociated with the organization at the time of loan. This second individual is co-responsible for follow up of the loan agreement and also signs the agreement.

Every loan needs to be linked to an organization. If the requestor of the loan changes its affiliation, the material stays in the organization that is on the loan agreement. No loans to unaffiliated individuals.
For the loan at hand, any extra information to be added on the package label, next to the requester and address; can be specified here; e.g. department, team or research group (at the time of loan).
The full address to which the loan will be, or was, send.

For example: loan agreement, material transfer agreement, prints of mail communication, evidence of mailing the material, ... Note: results (publications, datasets) can be linked here, but should also be linked to the separate specimens that were used in that publication.
Either the full object, or in case of destructive sampling, a part of the listed object (e.g. DNA samples, soil samples, living plants, tissues).

This can be photos or videos, to document condition, volume, ...; either before sending out the loan, or when receiving the loan. This URL leads to a folder, photo, video, ... that is saved in an INBO archive space. This could be on the INBO google folders, the INBO tandemVault or any other published open web URL.

label.typename: is valuation event of the object
label.typename_reverse: is object subjected to the valuation event

role.name: Administrators
role.description: Confers actions needed by those administering the system

role.name: Viewer
role.description: Allows users to only search and view - but not edit - catalogue entries

role.name: Soilcataloguers
role.description: The cataloguer for the soil archive can only edit reocrds with the type=soilObject (soil samples).

role.name: Soilmanagers
role.description: The manager for the soil archive can only edit and delete records with the type=soilObject (soil samples).

role.name: Collectionstewards
role.description: Can edit information considering loans: loan table, entity table. View all the rest.

group.name: soilcataloguers
group.description: Users who can add and edit catalogue entries

group.name: soilmanagers
group.description: Users who can add, edit and delete catalogue entries

group.name: collectionstewards
group.description: Users who can add, edit and delete loans and edit catalogue entries
